message.content: We refer to our knowledge of anatomy and physiology. The description of the substance binding to an allosteric site during muscle relaxation but with lesser affinity during contraction suggests that it binds to the myosin molecule in the H band, which is located in the middle of the sarcomere and is only exposed during muscle relaxation. Therefore, the correct answer is (B) II.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Based on the information provided, the active substance binds to an allosteric site on globular portions of a heavy chain dimer. During muscle relaxation, this substance binds with greater affinity, which suggests that it binds to a site that is more accessible during muscle relaxation. The H band represents the region of the sarcomere where there is no overlap between the thin and thick filaments during muscle relaxation, making it the most likely location for the site with the greatest affinity for the active substance. Therefore, the correct answer is (B) II (represented on image as H band).

We refer to textbooks or online resources on anatomy and physiology for help. The description in the question suggests that the substance binds with greater affinity during muscle relaxation, indicating that it is not involved in cross-bridge formation during muscle contraction. The globular head of the myosin filament binds with another contractile protein during muscle contraction, so the substance will have lesser affinity for the binding site. Therefore, the substance will have the greatest affinity during muscle relaxation, and the H band (represented as II) is the region where it is most likely to bind.

We refer to our knowledge of sarcomere anatomy. During muscle contraction, the sarcomere shortens as the actin filaments slide over the myosin filaments. The H band in the sarcomere represents the region where only myosin filaments are present and no overlapping actin filaments. This means that during muscle contraction, the myosin heads will bind with greater affinity to the allosteric site where the active substance is binding, making option (B) the correct answer.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine and notes on anatomy for help. The active substance is involved in muscle contraction, so it will bind with greater affinity during muscle contraction. During muscle contraction, the I band and H band will decrease in size, while the A band remains constant. The M line is in the center of the sarcomere and does not change in size during muscle contraction. Therefore, the globular head of the heavy chain dimer will bind with the greatest affinity during muscle contraction in the H band. Answer choice (B) is correct.

We refer to Wikipedia articles for help. The substance binds with greater affinity during muscle relaxation, which means it will bind to the globular heads of myosin when they are not attached to actin. This occurs during the H zone of the sarcomere, which corresponds to option B on the image. Therefore, the answer is (B) II.

We refer to basic anatomy textbooks for help. The H band corresponds to the region of the sarcomere where myosin filaments are present without overlapping with actin filaments during muscle contraction. Therefore, it is during muscle relaxation that the active substance in the energy drink is thought to bind with greater affinity to the allosteric site on the globular portions of a heavy chain dimer.

We refer to anatomy textbooks for help on this question. During muscle contraction, the H band, which contains only myosin filaments, becomes smaller as actin filaments slide inward, resulting in a closer overlap between the two types of filaments. This is the region where the active substance in the energy drink would have the greatest affinity, as it is involved in the binding of myosin to actin during muscle contraction.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The active substance binds with greater affinity during muscle relaxation but with lesser affinity when the globular head binds with another contractile protein. The H band is where the myosin is located during muscle relaxation, making it the portion of the sarcomere where the substance will have the greatest affinity during muscle contraction.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The active substance in the drink increases the activity of an ATPase involved in muscle contraction. This suggests that the substance will have the greatest affinity at the site where muscle contraction occurs, which is the H band.
